full_summary:
# Request for Proposal (RFP) for Senior Engineering Graduate Services

## Notice of Proposed Procurement

The Department of National Defence (DND) invites qualified suppliers to submit their proposals for the provision of senior engineering graduate services.

### File Number and Tier

File Number: W8476-246867/A
Tier: 1 (< $3.75M)

### Objectives

The intent of this RFP is to establish one (1) contract for five (5) initial years, with the option to extend the term of the contract by up to two (2) one-year irrevocable option periods under the same conditions. The contract will be awarded to the successful supplier under the Task and Solutions Professional Service (TSPS) Supply Arrangement (SA) number E60ZT-18TSPS.

### Time Frame and Location

The expected commencement date for the contract is ASAP, with the work to be performed in the National Capital Region (NCR), specifically at 975 Boulevard St-Joseph, Gatineau, Quebec.

### Security Requirements

The security requirements for this contract include a Secret-level security clearance for the supplier, with no document safeguarding requirements. Suppliers should refer to the Industrial Security Program (ISP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada for more information on personnel and organization security screening or security clauses.

### Eligible Suppliers

This RFP is open to the below-listed pre-qualified suppliers:

* 9468269 Canada Corp.
* Access Corporate Technologies Inc.
* AECOM Canada Ltd.
* ...
* WSP Canada Inc.

### Proposal Submission

Proposals must be submitted by the tender closing date of April 3, 2024, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time. RFP documents will be emailed directly to the qualified supply arrangement holders who are being invited to bid on this requirement. Bidders are advised that the RFP documents are not available on the Government Electronic Tendering System (GETS).

### Contact Information

For inquiries regarding this RFP, please contact the Contracting Authority:
Name: Kelsey Lawrence
Email: kelsey.lawrence2@forces.gc.ca
Phone: (343) 572-4397

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on this procurement.

## Additional Information

* Suppliers must comply with Treasury Board policies and directives on contracts awarded to former public servants.
* Bidders must provide required information as detailed in article 2.3 of Part 2 of the bid solicitation.
* Security clearance and
